questions.text: In the cold opening, when they asked which Anderson family got the table, who did Coach say the table was for?
questions.explanation:
The Blubberbutts.

	There were two Anderson parties so Coach asked which one. He didn't realize that the man was insulting the family that was rather large so he called the table for the Blubberbutts.

questions.text: When Sam told Carla to keep her hands off Diane, what did Carla say?
questions.explanation:
"I will if you will."

	Carla pretty much despised Diane and wanted to hurt her, prompting Sam to make his comment. Carla also hated that Diane was dating Sam, prompting her response.

Tuesday.

	Diane needed Tuesday off to go somewhere so she asked Carla to trade days off with her. Carla said "no" so Diane went to Sam about it.

questions.text: What happened with Norm and Vera?
options: They went on a second honeymoon
questions.explanation:
They separated.

	Norm was always making jokes about how he didn't care about his wife but he was not very happy about being separated from her.

Diane.

	Diane resigned in French which Sam thought was ridiculous. However, she said that it was better for everyone if she left because Sam gave her special favors since they were dating.

questions.text: How long did it take Diane to find a job?
questions.explanation:
2 weeks.

	Cliff asked Norm how it was that Diane found a job in only two weeks when Norm himself was still unemployed. One of the long running gags of "Cheers" was Norm and his lack of work most often, and various jobs he had.

questions.text: How did Norm and Vera meet?
options: They met at the grocery store.
They were at the same beach.
They were in jury duty together.
questions.explanation:
They were high school sweethearts.

	Norm said in another episode that Vera was the only woman he'd ever been with. He also admitted that he loved her even though he always made jokes about her.

questions.text: What song did Cliff sing when Norm called Vera?
questions.explanation:
"Are You Lonesome Tonight?".

	"Are You Lonesome Tonight" was written by Lou Handman and Roy Turk in 1926. It was made popular by Elvis Presley in 1960.

questions.text: What question did Sam answer that he didn't want to answer?
questions.explanation:
"Have you seen Diane naked?".

	Sam resisted answering it but Diane told him to, not knowing what the question was. Sam finally replied, "Yes I've seen her naked."

questions.text: Why did Carla bang her head on the bar?
questions.correct: Diane returned to work at the bar.
options: She found out she was pregnant again.
questions.explanation:
Diane returned to work at the bar.

	Carla was ecstatic about Diane leaving. However, when Diane returned she couldn't stand the thought so she started to bang her head on the bar.
